article.title: Age-dating Luminous Red Galaxies observed with the Southern African Large Telescope

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main advantage of the Cosmic Chronometers (CC) method for measuring the Hubble parameter?
choices: It uses quantities that require the Hubble parameter to be integrated along the line of sight.
It relies on the nature of the metric between the chronometers and observers.
It provides an integrated measurement of H(z) out to redshift z.
It uses a differential approach, measuring the age difference between ensembles of galaxies at different redshifts.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of stellar population model is generally found to be a good description for LRG spectra?
choices: Models with extended star formation histories only.
Models that specifically account for ongoing star formation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the estimated value of H(z ≈ 0.47) as derived in this study using SALT LRG spectra?
What is the equation used to calculate the Hubble parameter H(z) from the ages (t) and redshift difference (Δz) in the CC method?
